Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lefteris G
Reviews.Content: is a nice small hotel very clean BUT with very small rooms and an xsmall bath but is very central well located and the breacfast is good

Reviews.Title: “Fairly nice”
Reviews.Author: Catro2
Reviews.Content: For my dad's birthday we went to Rome. We stayed in this hotel, which i can't really remember, all i know is i really liked it. It had lovely surroundings and it was really nice. I would definitely go there again for a weekend visit and would recommend it to you.

Reviews.Title: “My Little Escape”
Reviews.Author: mrmfield21
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutley wonderful, the staff were brilliant, the location is very good for the price which in itself is brilliant and the rooms were very clean. i was in a single room so it was not huge but i t was VERY comfortable. the view was nothing to write home about, but at the price i paid i was not going to complain. Another great thing about this place is that it is only a 15 minute walk from the Piazza di Spanga (Spanish Steps). Fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ginko26
Reviews.Content: Date : 25th November 2007 We have just returned from Rome (5 days city-break) where we stayed in Luxor. It wasn't great... The hotel have a very good location - close enough to most of the major attractions, but .... First of all it is very small hotel, very hard to find - tiny sign and at the time we went - covered by some sheets for renovation. it would be OK if they put some sings outside covers. but the issue for us was the water. if you want to have a shower you have an option boiling or freezing cold water, there was no way to set the water temp - very annoying. next thing - the noise. the hotel is located at the corner of 2 very busy streets, and all night and day the noise was really tiresome. you would need earplugs. rooms are tiny - but you can cope with that - at the and of the day you are outside. breakfast - OK, nothing special - croissant, bread roll, some spread cheese and jam, tea or coffee. there is air conditioning but it didnt work (november in rome is quite cold) but i would assume that in the summer - there could be a problem with it - looking at all facilities i dont give them much credit. so location - good and the rest - not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find worse”
Reviews.Author: Filipo76
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Luxor for 5 nights. Pros: centreal location near termini station. breakfast is ok. That's about it. Cons: hot water ran out every time we took a shower. Often had to wait 15 minutes for hot water to come back. Showers and washroom are are extremely tight. Rooms are very small and smell very bad. Noisy location. Paint is peeling in the room. I have stayed at numerous hotels in Italy and there is no reason this should be rated 3 stars. 2 stars at best.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: mfprimo
Reviews.Content: Single rooms are clean but small,expecially the bathroom. Loocation is central for business traveler, near governmental offices and agencies. The price is in the low range for Rome. Unfortunately, rooms with windows on main street are noisy.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: geodielass7
Reviews.Content: hotel luxor august 2007 have just had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel my husband we found it a very good location to get to all the main attractions on foot ,staff were very helpful couldnot do enough for us ,it is a basic hoel with basic breakfast but good for the prices will definetly book this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: eandmottawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Luxor for one evening prior to our return to Canada since it was within walking distance to Termini station. We paid 150Euro and it was not worth the price at all. When we first arrived to Rome late April, we stayed at the Canova ( I will post a review for that hotel) for the same price and loved it. The Luxor does not compare. The air conditioner is very loud and the hotel is off a very busy street so expect a lot of noise during the evening. Our room was on the 2nd floor and when we woke up in the morning our room stunk of smoke. We went to check out and discovered the night desk clerk was smoking away. We reminded him of the no smoking sign posted right behind him. He just muttered something about being alone all night? Would not recommend this hotel there are others out there that are much better. Ottawa, Ontario

Reviews.Title: “Antique and lovely Hotel Luxor”
Reviews.Author: Birdie2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Luxor the first week of October 2006 and again for one night before our flight home mid month, so we got to stay in two different rooms. Both were decorated in antiques and one had a beautiful mosaic floor . Both had remodeled, tiled, good sized, private bathrooms with plenty of hot water in the nice shower/tub combos. There are stairs but they are wide and easy to climb. There is a private safe in each room. There were flowers in the window boxes on the balconies. The breakfast was large with a good variety set up in a pretty dining room and the kitchen ladies made you what ever kind of coffee you wanted to drink. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. They helped us with tour problems even though it wasnt a tour company that they usually worked with. The restaurant recommendation we got from them was so great we ate there 3 times! They arranged for an affordable taxi to the airport in the early morning hours. The lobby is gorgeous, though small with no bar area. My ONLY complaint is that the pillows were hard and thin and the mattresses could probably be replaced, too. We definately would stay there again as the location is unbeatable for convenient walking around Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nazly
Reviews.Content: We booked last minute at hotel Luxor, reviews seemed OK & it was within the price range we were looking for. Location was perfect, it was the best thing about the hotel. Other than that the hotel was basic. The bathroom was TINY even by European standards & the bed springs were loose, a big problem if you have a bad back. We never tried breakfast because the hotel didnt seem too enticing & we preferred the cafe next door. Dont be fooled by the TV, even though the guy at the reception insisted there were 2 English channels, the only English we heard was on MTV songs. Other than that all Italian & German channels. The hotel staff was OK, though hardly friendly by Italian standards, we expected a warmer attitude. All in all we wont stay there again, we can do much better at these price ranges if we planned well, but if you're stuck on time & absolutely need to go to Rome, this hotel does it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, terrible breakfast”
Reviews.Author: An_taistealaí
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights in sunny Rome in early October. Hotel Luxor is well located, just off via Nazionale. Only 5 min walk from Termini and about 15 min walk to Trevi Fountain. The hotel room that we were given was very clean. The bathroom was spotless with lovely large soft white towels which were replaced every day. However, it was TINY. If you are a large person, do not stay in this hotel or you will be unable to use the toilet / shower facilities. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. However, we found it a little strange that the hotel could not provide an iron for use in the room. The breakfast was awful......we only went the first morning. It wasn't worth returning to on the subsequent mornings. Stale bread rolls, orange/pink coloured water instead of proper orange juice, tiny little ramekin bowls instead of proper breakfast cereal bowls, luke warm milk instead of cold milk for cereal. I can't comment on the coffee but the tea wasn't great....but that's a general problem in Rome rather than in this hotel. There's a "despar" grocery shop across the road on Via Nazionale....buy your breakfast supplies there :-) I found our room to be noisy. I could clearly hear activities in the adjacent room and the traffic on via Nazionale. There were a lot of channels on the TV but none in English....not even CNN!! Would I recommend this hotel? Well, that depends. It's location suited us perfectly and it was clean. It's expensive enough for what you get.....I wouldn't have considered it a 3* hotel. But, we found Rome to be very expensive in all aspects, so the hotel price was probably in keeping with all other prices in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good price range for its location. The staff are very helpful and the rooms may be small, but they are very clean. The breakfast is not grand, but it does the job. Main attractions like the Colesseum and Trevi Fountain are in walking distance. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great location and price”
Reviews.Author: MaxandMilo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and a good value for the price. It is within walking distance to the train station and all the major sites of Rome. The rooms were very clean and staff helpful. The biggest downside to this hotel is the room size. They are very small but for the price I felt like it was still a great deal. And I have stayed in other places in Rome and the rooms were small there too. The breakfast was ok, nothing to brag about. There is a great restaurant for dinner on the same street as the hotel called The Gran Cafe Strega, everything was excellent, huge portions, great prices, nice atmosphere. It was one of the best places I ate in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but tiny!”
Reviews.Author: LibbyPittsburgh_PA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel first week in August. Good location- within walking distance of the main city attractions like Trevi fountain, Colloseum etc. However, be prepared to stay in a VERY small room, with even smaller bathroom (or rather- shower room). In fact the shower cabin was so tiny that my husband (medium-built, 6’ tall) could barely fit in there! Otherwise, no complaints – the staff was friendly and our room was cleaned up every day. The air-conditioning worked well and it was quiet enough at night. The breakfast was just okay (great cappuccino though!) – croissants, yogurts, spreadable cheese, and selection of marmalades. I wish they would add some cold cuts and breads. If you’re traveling on budget the hotel won’t probably disappoint you, although I expected somewhat better accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: amarie
Reviews.Content: Hotel Luxor was a small little hotel. The location was great! It was right near the subway/train station. The staff was very nice and helpful! I would definately recomment this hotel if you don't mind VERY small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the marvellous Hotel Luxor, well located near the famous Spanish Stairs, the Trevi Fountain, the Colosseum, bus and subway,.... The staff was very friendly, the rooms very clean (although a little bit small, but no problem!) and soundproofed. Breakfast was also enough (cappucino, tea, croissants, cornflakes, cakes,....). We only forgot an Italian electricity plug for the battery charger! We will recommend this hotel to our friends!!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeborahATL
Reviews.Content: Hotel Luxor is a wonderful little hotel. The location is perfect, walking distance to the Forum, Piazza Navona, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, etc. We had two different rooms. The first was very pretty with high ceiling, deep plaster moulding, nicely decorated, good street view. We had a last minute reservation and unfortunately had to switch rooms but the second room was not bad, a little smaller with a very tiny bathroom but that was no big deal. The window overlooked the back door of the kitchen so we did have some noise early in the morning from the kitchen but that was no big deal either. Everyone at the hotel was so nice and helpful that I have only praise for Hotel Luxor. It is an excellent value for the money because of the location and the accommodations are good to excellent depending on which room you get.

Reviews.Title: “Top staying at the Luxor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I could not disagree more on the bad review on the Luxor Hotel in Rome. I had a very, very pleasant staying and enjoyed the laid back atmosphere and the extremely helpful and caring staff. I'd gladly reccommend the Hotel Luxor as a top destination in Rome. Just my two cents. Cheers, Goffredo, Paris, France

Reviews.Title: “Complete dump - DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: fdnewyork
Reviews.Content: Do not believe the pictures on the web sites you see about the Hotel Luxor. It is a complete dump - shabby, smelly, loud and hot (when we were there.) Our room, a triple, was tiny with a bathroom that smelled of urine upon arrrival. The staff was unhelpful. We checked out after one night and lost 3 nights - of course they did not refund us any money - but it was worth learning that you get what you pay for. Hotel Luxor is an awful place - a nightmare of a European hotel at its worst!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Luxor
HotelInfo.Address: Via A. Depretis 104, 00184 Rome, Italy
